title: 115_hr2692
content: The Act may be cited as the "Veterans Education Flexibility Act". According to a 2010 report, 20.6% of eligible veterans were unable to use their GI bill benefits due to expiration. The time limits for using these benefits do not align with the realities of the modern economy, as many veterans delay education to work or recover from injuries. Access to education and job retraining is crucial for veterans. Access to education and job retraining is essential for veterans' success in today's economy. The purpose of this Act is to remove time limits and retroactively restore educational benefits for veterans under various GI Bill programs. Elimination of time limitation for use of eligibility and entitlement to educational assistance under various GI Bill programs. The Montgomery GI Bill-Active Duty is amended to extend entitlement to educational assistance expiring during a quarter or semester for individuals enrolled in educational institutions operating on a quarter or semester system. The Montgomery GI Bill-Active Duty is amended to extend entitlement to educational assistance for individuals enrolled in educational institutions not regularly operated on the quarter or semester system. The period of entitlement will be extended to the end of the course or for 12 weeks, whichever is shorter. The Montgomery GI Bill-Active Duty is amended to extend entitlement to educational assistance expiring during a quarter or semester or after a major portion of a course is complete. Amendments include changes to Chapter 33 of title 38, United States Code, regarding time limitations for entitlement use. The text discusses amendments to various sections of title 38, United States Code, including changes to the Post-Vietnam Era Veterans' Educational Assistance Program and the Post-9/11 GI Bill. Amendments involve redesignating subsections and extending entitlement to educational assistance expiring during a quarter or semester. Amendments to title 38, United States Code include changes to educational assistance programs for veterans. Section 3031 applies to termination of entitlement, with references to specific sections updated. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. Extension of entitlement to educational assistance expiring during a quarter or semester or after a major portion of a course is complete. Conforming amendments made to Chapter 33 of title 38, United States Code, including changes to sections 3312(b) and 3319. Conforming amendments for Reserve Component Programs also implemented. Section 16133(b) of title 10, United States Code, is amended to update provisions for Selected Reserve, while Section 16164(b)(2) is amended for Other Reserve Components. Amendments include changes to section 3031 of title 38. The Veterans Education Flexibility Act applies to individuals entitled to educational assistance under chapters 30, 32, or 33 of title 38, United States Code. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will disregard any delimiting date eliminated by the Act for determining entitlement to educational assistance.
